result.execSummary:
The defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $2,040.00 to Eduardo C. Restitution to be paid FIRST before costs, fees and surcharges.

***Court ordered a restitution hearing date be set to address the restitution request for Teresa T.***

Court ordered the restitution be paid joint and several. Clerk notified by the State after the proceedings were over none of the co-actors were charged with any of the cases the defendant plead to or were read-in.

***11-05-2015/Judge Stephanie Rothstein***
   IT IS HEREBY STIPULATED and agreed, between the State of Wisconsin by Assistant District Attorney Chad Wozniak and by the Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza that the restitution amount requested by Teresa Tetting of $1903.15 is true and correct.
   With the application of $460 in bail money applied to restitution, the amount due and owing to Teresa Tetting is $1,433.10 which shall be paid by the Defendant, jointly and severally.

Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Defendant to enter into a payment plan.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).

If revoked, court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds/earnings.

Court reinstated the cash bail in the amount of $2,500.00 previously forfeited on 2/25/15. Bail on deposit to be applied towards restitution FIRST. Any remaining amount to be applied towards costs, fees and surcharges.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment/counseling.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to serve 7 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction. Defendant may participate in educational/vocational programming at the House of Correction. Defendant may have release for medical appointments, verifiable counseling appointments, and the Day Reporting Center.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Refund Packets

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp on behalf of Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for restitution hearing. Defense counsel advised the court the defendant is not contesting the restitution as listed in the stipulation filed on 11/05/15. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1,903.15 to be paid to Teresa T. Court ordered the restitution be paid joint and several. Clerk notified by the State after the sentencing proceedings were over none of the co-actors were charged with any of the cases the defendant plead to or were read-in. Restitution to be paid during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Restitution Order signed and filed. Court took no further action.
Signed stipulation regarding restitution received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
CLERK PLEASE RETURN THIS FILE TO GUSTAVO/ANNE IN CASE CLOSING AFTER RESTITUTION HEARING IS HELD.

As to COUNTS 2, 3, 4, & 5-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2-5 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Sworn as Interpreter: Dawn Maldonado. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation. Plea hearing proceeded. 
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Two Victim Impact Statements with attached restitution worksheets received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case passed from earlier this morning to address the court's trial calendar. Due to the lateness of the hour, Court is unable to hear the case this morning. Parties do not object to an adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing date. Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia. Parties are not prepared to proceed today. Parties request a short adjournment pending a possible resolution with another matter set for trial in Branch 25 today. Court ordered this matter passed to address jury trial calendar.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in custody.  
Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.    Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Ruth Garcia.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court sets bail in the amount of $5,000.00 CASH with turn over to JusticePoint for Supervision.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 6-27-15.  Defendant REMAINS REMANDED.  The Court to address bail at Return on Warrant hearing.
Bench warrant in file.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Discharge Summary from Justice Point, received and filed.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza not in court.   Defendant failing to appear, as well as failing to provide Justice Point with a valid prescription for opiates used, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Possible victim(s) identified; therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report, received and filed.  Defendant tested positive for opiates.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Justice Point contacted the court to advise that  defendant tested positive, but claimed he has a prescription for that drug.  Court had defendant brought to court; defense counsel was unable to be reached.  Court ordered defendant to bring in the prescription to Justice Point; defendant, thru interpreter, indicated that he would bring in the prescription tomorrow, 2/17/15.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and will await the report from Justice Point.
Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court.   Sworn as interpreter:  Ms. Brenda Bartholomew.

Defendant arrived late.  Court admonished defendant.  Parties  requested another scheduling date. Justice Point report received and filed.  Defendant compliant.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  File retained in court.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Ms. Brenda Bartholomew.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court with attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Bartholomew.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to co-defendants lower pending cases.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/5/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KAR; Mayra S.; Robert R.; Teresa T. or Eduardo CM or their residences

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Uriel Velasquez-Melgoza in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
